question: A.05 (1 point) Which ONE of the following is the reason for operating with thermal neutrons instead of fast neutrons?

answers.answer: a. The fission cross section of the fuel is much higher for thermal neutrons than fast neutrons.
answers.feedback: Correct. Reference: Duderstadt and Hamilton, Nuclear Reactor Analysis, page 81.

answers.answer: b. Neutron absorption in non-fuel material increases exponentially as neutron energy increases.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Duderstadt and Hamilton, Nuclear Reactor Analysis, page 81.

answers.answer: c. Doppler and moderator temperature coefficients become positive as neutron energy increases.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Duderstadt and Hamilton, Nuclear Reactor Analysis, page 81.

answers.answer: d. Neutron economy is increased since thermal neutrons are less likely to leak out of the core than fast neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Duderstadt and Hamilton, Nuclear Reactor Analysis, page 81.

answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, page 5-25.

answers.answer: c. the reactor is subcritical and the count rate increase is due to the buildup of delayed neutron precursors.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, page 5-25.

answers.answer: d. the reactor is critical and the count rate increase is due to the buildup of delayed neutron precursors.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Burn, Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, page 5-25.

question: A.12 (1 point) Which one of the following describes the Technical Specifications “Shutdown Margin” of the RPI reactor?

answers.answer: a. The amount of negative reactivity which would be inserted into the core if all the rods were within one inch of being bottomed.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: RPI Technical Specifications Definitions

answers.answer: b. The amount of reactivity the reactor is subcritical by given a specific set of conditions.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: RPI Technical Specifications Definitions

answers.answer: c. The minimum amount of reactivity needed to keep the reactor subcritical by means of the control rods and assuming the most reactive rod is in the most reactive position.
answers.feedback: Correct. Reference: RPI Technical Specifications Definitions

answers.answer: d. The amount of reactivity inserted if all the control rods are bottomed and the reactor is subcritical by at least $1.00.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: RPI Technical Specifications Definitions

question: A.14 (1 point) Which one of the following describes how delayed neutrons affect control of the reactor?

answers.answer: a. More delayed neutrons are produced than prompt neutrons resulting in a longer time to reach a stable subcritical countrate.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A, Nuclear Reactor Engineering,  Krieger Publishing, Malabar, Florida, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.

answers.answer: b. Delayed neutrons are born at higher energies than prompt neutrons resulting in a shorter reactor period from increased leakage.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A, Nuclear Reactor Engineering,  Krieger Publishing, Malabar, Florida, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.

answers.answer: c. Delayed neutrons take longer to thermalize than prompt neutrons resulting in a longer reactor period.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A, Nuclear Reactor Engineering,  Krieger Publishing, Malabar, Florida, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.

answers.answer: d. Delayed neutrons increase the average neutron lifetime resulting in a longer reactor period.
answers.feedback: Correct. Reference: Glasstone, S. and Sesonske, A, Nuclear Reactor Engineering,  Krieger Publishing, Malabar, Florida, 1991, § 5.20, p. 236.

question: A.15 (1 point) A 1/M curve is being generated as fuel is loaded into the core. answers.answer: b. criticality will occur earlier (i.e., with fewer elements loaded.)
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Laboratory 2 Experiment.

answers.answer: c. criticality will occur later (i.e., with more elements loaded.)
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Laboratory 2 Experiment.

answers.answer: d. criticality will be completely unpredictable.
